meanings.definition: To remove or release from a curb.
meanings.sent1: She was uncurbing her bike to ride freely around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The workers were uncurbing the sidewalk to make it accessible for wheelchairs.
meanings.sent3: After uncurbing the dog, it happily ran around the park.
meanings.sent4: His creativity soared after uncurbing his imagination from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: Uncurbing the gate, she felt a sense of liberation as she stepped into the unknown.

meanings.definition: To free from restrictions or limitations.
meanings.sent1: The new law aimed at uncurbing the rights of citizens to express themselves.
meanings.sent2: By uncurbing his fears, he was able to pursue his dreams without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to be uncurbing the laws of physics with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like uncurbing a river, flowing freely and joyfully.
meanings.sent5: Uncurbing her potential, she achieved more than she ever thought possible.
